description: Sample from the most authentic collection of Hadith - includes hadiths about fire

hadiths.translation: Actions are but by intention and every man shall have but that which he intended.
hadiths.explanation: This hadith establishes the fundamental principle that all actions are judged by intentions.

hadiths.arabic_text: ما يصيب المسلم من نصب ولا وصب ولا هم ولا حزن ولا اذى ولا غم حتى الشوكة يشاكها الا كفر الله بها من خطاياه
hadiths.translation: No fatigue, nor disease, nor sorrow, nor sadness, nor hurt, nor distress befalls a Muslim, not even if it were the prick he receives from a thorn, but that Allah expiates some of his sins for that.
hadiths.explanation: This hadith provides comfort by explaining that all forms of hardship, even pain like fire or the smallest suffering, serve as a means for Allah to forgive sins.
hadiths.chapter: The reward of a believer for his sufferings

hadiths.arabic_text: النار جهنم سعرت فقالت رب اكلني بعضي بعضا فاذن لها بنفسين نفس في الشتاء ونفس في الصيف
hadiths.translation: The Hell-fire complained to its Lord saying: O my Lord! Some parts of me have consumed the other parts. So Allah allowed it to take two breaths - one in winter and one in summer.
hadiths.explanation: This hadith explains the extreme heat of summer and cold of winter as breaths of Hell-fire, demonstrating the intensity of the punishment in the afterlife.

hadiths.arabic_text: ان كان في شيء من ادويتكم خير ففي شرطة محجم او شربة عسل او لذعة بنار واكره الكي
hadiths.translation: If there is any good in your medicines, then it is in cupping, a gulp of honey, or branding with fire - but I hate branding (cauterizing).
hadiths.explanation: This hadith mentions the therapeutic use of fire in medical treatment, showing that fire can be used for healing purposes when applied correctly.

hadiths.arabic_text: يقول الله تعالى انا عند ظن عبدي بي وانا معه اذا ذكرني
hadiths.translation: Allah says: I am as My servant thinks I am, and I am with him when he remembers Me. If he remembers Me in himself, I remember him in Myself, and if he remembers Me in a gathering, I remember him in a gathering better than it.
hadiths.explanation: This sacred hadith (hadith qudsi) shows Allah's closeness to those who remember Him, whether in private or public gatherings, promising rewards that surpass even fire's punishment.
hadiths.chapter: Allah's statement: And it is He Who begins creation, then repeats it
